page.title: 20Interesting Houses.
page.content: In{Horsley}there is a{Court House}in which trials were held.The court-room ceiling has a wooden panel which was removed during trials.There is a C16th dovecote in the grounds.In the cellar there is a horse-drawn cider press. In{Nympsfield}there is{Sheepcotes,}a house without electricity.They use oil lamps.A telephone has been installed recently.The owner who built the house started in 1950.The stone came from Owlpen House and the lintels are made from the garden steps.The tiles were from an old barn,and cost Â£45.Through the Estate wall, a gateway was made.A {crouch-burial skeleton}was found,dated {300B.C.}with perfect teeth.It's in the {British Museum. Chapel House}(formerly the Red Lion)has a panelled schoolroom and also the room for the Night School started in 1892.Until 1923 Mass was said in the'open fireplace' room.
